title: Moral Money: 'Should I stop buying organic food so I can purchase a house?'
text:
My partner and I always purchase organic vegetables and free range eggs as we feel this is best for the environment and tastes better than the alternative.

However, we are struggling to save for a house and need every penny we can get. We are prepared to cut back drastically to buy a property. Should we switch to caged eggs and non-organic food to help us get the deposit we need?

SV, Hampshire

It is not easy to save for a property deposit. The average first-time buyer now needs £33,252 to get onto the ladder, according to Halifax, the bank.

This means it is common for those trying to buy a home to scrimp and save for years before they have enough cash, and you are no different.

The dilemma...
description: My partner and I always purchase organic vegetables and free range eggs as we feel this is best for the environment and tastes better than the alternative.
